KPU akan Tempuh Semua Pintu Agar Eks Koruptor Tak Maju Pilkada
04 Nov 2019, 19:30 by Mochamad Zhacky
Jakarta - KPU menegaskan akan menempuh semua pintu agar pelarangan eks koruptor maju di Pilkada dapat disahkan sebagai aturan. Kini, pelarangan tersebut dituangkan dalam rancangan perubahan peraturan KPU (PKPU) Nomor 3/2017.
"Jadi kami mengupayakan semua pintu yang mungkin kita tempuh. Untuk gagasan ini terwujud tetap akan kita tempuh," kata Komisioner KPU Pramono Ubaid di Kompleks MPR/DPR, Senayan, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).
Dalam rancangan perubahan PKPU Nomor 3/2017 aturan mengenai pelarangan mantan terpidana kasus korupsi maju dipilkada ada dalam Pasal 4 huruf h. Pramono menyebut akan memperjuangkan hal tersebut juga melalui revisi Undang-Undang (UU) Pilkada.
"Upaya KPU untuk mengatur soal mantan napi koruptor dalam pencalonan pilkada ini kan bukan hanya kita lakukan melalui penyusunan PKPU ini, tapi kalaupun nanti ada revisi UU, entah kita tidak tahu kapan waktunya, gagasan ini tetap juga akan kita lakukan," jelasnya.

KPU will take all the gates so that the ex-corruptor does not advance in the regional election
04 Nov 2019, 19:30 by Mochamad Zhacky
Jakarta - KPU asserted that it will take all the doors so that the ban on ex-corruptors going forward in the elections can be passed as a rule. Now, the ban is outlined in the draft amendment to KPU (PKPU) Regulation No. 3/2017.
"So we are trying all the doors that we might take. For this idea to be realized we will still take it," said Commissioner Pramono Ubaid in the MPR / DPR Complex, Senayan, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
In the draft amendment to PKPU No. 3/2017 the rules regarding the banning of ex-convicted advanced corruption cases in the regional head are in Article 4 letter h. Pramono said he would fight for this also through the revision of the Law (UU) on the elections.
"The efforts of the KPU to regulate the matter of ex-convicted corruptors in the nomination of the election is not only done through the preparation of this PKPU, but even if there is a later revision of the Act, whether we don't know when, we will also do this idea," he explained.
